meanings.definition: Afflicted with a disease or curse
meanings.sent1: The poor cat looked poxed with a terrible illness.
meanings.sent2: She felt poxed with bad luck after losing her favorite toy.
meanings.sent3: The magician accidentally poxed himself with a spell meant for the rabbit.
meanings.sent4: The old house seemed poxed with mysterious creaks and groans.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds poxed the sky, threatening a storm.

meanings.definition: To curse or afflict with a disease
meanings.sent1: The witch decided to pox the village for not inviting her to the festival.
meanings.sent2: He believed his rival had poxed him with a spell to fail the exam.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous fairy poxed the cookies with a shrinking potion.
meanings.sent4: The evil queen poxed the mirror to show only her beauty.
meanings.sent5: The pirate captain poxed his crew with a contagious laughter.

meanings.sent1: The doctor warned about the dangers of the pox spreading in the town.
meanings.sent2: During the outbreak, many people feared catching the deadly pox.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled at the idea of a chicken pox party.
meanings.sent4: The historical novel vividly described the horrors of the smallpox pox.
meanings.sent5: The quarantine sign indicated a case of the pox in the building.
